results.title: How we adapt
results.creator_credit: William Banting, CTV Television Network and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Notes the increasing amount of stress and stress-related illness in people’s lives. Emphasises the fact that, like some illnesses, stress may also be psychosomatic and controllable by the adoption of stress management techniques. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: A Place of dreams: National Air and Space Museum
results.creator_credit: Peter S Vogt and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: An examination of the Smithsonian Institute, home of America’s early planes. Shows through the use of early film and still photographs, the Wright Brothers’ early failures and successes; looks at the restoration of old planes at the museum; and presents a history of the development of flight in the United States. Presented by Cliff Robertson. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Why me?
results.creator_credit: Derek Lamb, Janet Perlman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Everyone ponders how he or she will face the knowledge of certain and imminent death. This animated film shows the reactions of one individual whose doctor has just told him that he has only a short time to live. In a terse and sometimes humorous dialogue with his doctor, Nesbitt Spoon runs the gamut of emotions commonly experienced by people trying to deal with this devastating situation.

results.title: Kate and Anna McGarrigle
results.creator_credit: Caroline Leaf, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Using a combination of animation and documentary techniques, filmmaker Caroline Leaf has created an easygoing mood in this informal portrait of the acclaimed singer-songwriters from Quebec. Highlights of the film include excerpts from their dibut concert at Carnegie Hall; a look at the songwriting/recording process, McGarrigle style; and conversations with the sisters, their supporters, and their critics.

results.title: Basic movie making
results.brief_description: Explains the techniques for camera steadiness, zooming and panning, as well as ways in which to make movies visually interesting. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Otto: zoo gorilla

results.title: What makes weather?
results.creator_credit: David Jay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the concepts and terminology of weather forecasting. Uses time-lapse cinematography to show cloud formations and topical influences, and live-action experiments and animation to illustrate unequal heating and the resulting effects of cold and warm air masses.
